Package gui

Class ReliableSensor

java.lang.Object
gui.ReliableSensor
All Implemented Interfaces:
DistanceSensor
Direct Known Subclasses:
UnreliableSensor
public class ReliableSensor extends Object implements DistanceSensor
Author:
Alex Longo Class: ReliableSensor Responsibilities: Uses the maze and its floorplan to measure the distance between the robot and obstacles (wallboards). Provides that information to ReliableRobot. Collaborators: Maze, ReliableRobot

  • Method Details

    • distanceToObstacle

      public int distanceToObstacle​(int[] currentPosition, CardinalDirection currentDirection, float[] powersupply) throws Exception
      This method tells the distance to an obstacle (a wallboard) that the sensor measures. Distance is measured in the number of cells towards that obstacle.
      Specified by:
      distanceToObstacle in interface DistanceSensor
      Parameters:
      currentPosition - is the current location as (x,y) coordinates
      currentDirection - specifies the direction of the robot
      powersupply - is an array of length 1, whose content is modified to account for the power consumption for sensing
      Returns:
      number of steps towards obstacle if obstacle is visible in a straight line of sight, Integer.MAX_VALUE otherwise.
      Throws:
      Exception - with message SensorFailure if the sensor is currently not operational PowerFailure if the power supply is insufficient for the operation
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null or if currentPosition is outside of legal range (currentPosition[0] < 0 || currentPosition[0] >= width) (currentPosition[1] < 0 || currentPosition[1] >= height)
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the powersupply is out of range (powersupply < 0)

    • setMaze

      public void setMaze​(Maze maze)
      This method provides the maze information that is necessary to make a ReliableSensor able to calculate distances.
      Specified by:
      setMaze in interface DistanceSensor
      Parameters:
      maze - the maze for this game
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if parameter is null or if it does not contain a floor plan

    • setSensorDirection

      public void setSensorDirection​(Robot.Direction mountedDirection)
      This method takes a provided angle, or the relative direction at which this ReliableSensor is mounted on the robot. If the direction is left, then the ReliableSensor is pointing towards the left hand side of the robot at a 90 degree angle from the forward direction. This method sets the sensor object's direction value.
      Specified by:
      setSensorDirection in interface DistanceSensor
      Parameters:
      mountedDirection - is the ReliableSensor's relative direction
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if parameter is null

    • getEnergyConsumptionForSensing

      public float getEnergyConsumptionForSensing()
      This method returns the amount of energy this ReliableSensor uses for calculating the distance to an obstacle exactly once.
      Specified by:
      getEnergyConsumptionForSensing in interface DistanceSensor
      Returns:
      the amount of energy used for using the sensor once

    • startFailureAndRepairProcess

      public void startFailureAndRepairProcess​(int meanTimeBetweenFailures, int meanTimeToRepair) throws UnsupportedOperationException
      PROJECT 4 METHOD
      Specified by:
      startFailureAndRepairProcess in interface DistanceSensor
      Parameters:
      meanTimeBetweenFailures - is the mean time in seconds, must be greater than zero
      meanTimeToRepair - is the mean time in seconds, must be greater than zero
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if method not supported
